greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of compositions of n in which each part p has multiplicity p.
comment: a(n) = 0 for n in {A001422}, a(n) > 0 for n in {A003995}.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..4500
maple: b:= proc(n, i, p) option remember; `if`(n=0, p!, `if`(i<1, 0,
mathematica: b[n_, i_, p_] := b[n, i, p] = If[n==0, p!, If[i<1, 0, b[n, i-1, p] + If[i^2 >n, 0, b[n-i^2, i-1, p+i]/i!]]]; a[n_] := b[n, Floor[Sqrt[n]], 0]; Table[ a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 08 2017, translated from Maple *)
xref: Cf. A033461 (the same for partitions), A336269.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 14 2014
